titles.title: Gädlä Libanos “Vita of Libanos” / Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos” / Mälkәʾa Libanos “Image of Libanos”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Gädlä Libanos “Vita of Libanos” (fols. 3ra–47va) II) Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos”: 11 miracles, preceded by a short praise to Libanos (fols. 47vb–62vb[l.4]) III) Mälkәʾa Libanos “Image of Libanos”: 29 strophes (fols. 62vb[l.10]–65rb).

donors.donor: Zä-Wäldä Maryam is mentioned in the supplication formulas of Texts I and II (e.g., fols. 3va, l.16; 5rb, l.2; 12va, ls. 1-2; 30va, ls. 10-11; 49ra, l.12; 58rb, l.1; 62vb, l.2). Other names are mentioned in the supplication formulas of Texts I and II, along with Zä-Wäldä Maryam or separately: Wälättä Maryam (e.g., fols. 3va, l.17; 4rb, l.11; 5rb, ls. 3-4; 29rb, l.19; 54vb, l.1); Wäldä Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 4rb, ls. 10-11; 7va, l.12; 17ra, ls. 1-2; 21ra, ls. 1-2; 56rb, l.5; 58ra, ls. 15-16); Wälättä Mikaʾel (e.g., s. fols.: 7vb, l.7; 48rb, l.18; 58ra, l.16). The name Gäbrä Maryam is added interlineally, by a recent hand, in blue pen (fol. 30va, ls. 11-12).

txstates.txstate: Fols. 6-7 are cut at the bottom. Holes in fols. 3, 6, 8, 16, 22, 28, 29, 36, 67. Holes carefully amended in fols. 36, 55.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: triple line fillet, triple circle, cross hatching, wave form, interlaced line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) –II (8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(6/fols. 35r–40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r–48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 57r–64v) – B(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 65r–67v).

taunit.mr-info: All data are taken from fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre. Hand b: poor.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-64vb. Hand b: fol. 65rab.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; name of the protagonist (both Libanos and Mäṭaˤ); the word sälam; groups of line on the incipit page of Text I; incipits of some subsections in Text I; incipit of each miracle in Text II; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለዓለ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fols. 21ra, l.2; 47va, l.2) ለዓ፡ ለዓም፡ ን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fols. 12va, l.3) ለ፡ ዓ፡ ን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fol. 13rb, l.19) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fol. 17ra, l.2) ለዓም፡ አለም፡ አሜን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fols. 33rb, l.18 – 33va, l.1) ለ፡ ዓ፡ አሜን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fol. 34vb, l.18) ለዓ፡ ለም፡ ን፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (esp. fol. 58ra, l.16) ገብ፡ for ገብረ፡ (e.g. fols. 55vb, l.3; 56rb, l.5) ምስ፡ for ምስለ፡ (e.g. fols. 42rb, l.11; 54ra, l.17) ወበ፡ የሃ፡ ምለ፡ for ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ (esp. fol. 54va, l.19) የሃ፡ for የሃሉ፡ (e.g. fol. 55vb, l.2) ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (throughout Text III) ሰ፡ for ሰላም፡ (e.g. fols. 63rb, l.10; 63vb, l.11)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - For the Texts of Gädlä Libanos, Täʾamrä Libanos and Mälkәʾa Libanos compare them to the edited version: A. BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003 (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]). - Text II is preceded by a short praise (on fol. 47va, ls. 3-19) in honour of the Saint. It is written in a smaller script but most probably by the same hand. - In the incipits of the Miracles (Text II), both names of the protagonist (Libanos and Mäṭaˤ) are alternatively used. Lacuna between Text II and Text III (fol. 62vb, ls. 4-9). - In Text III, as compared to the edited version (cp. A. BAUSI, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003a (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]), 206-212 [text] and 119-122 [tr.]), one strophe at the end is missing. - The ultimate portion of Text III is written on the first (unruled) leaf of quire B, probably by the hand different from that of the main text (hand a). - A ruled line at the bottom was not used by the scribe, on fols. 3r-10v, 35r-36v. - The rubrication is mostly carried out in reddish-brown; the ink used for the names of the donors is of somewhat different tones (e.g., cp. Wäldä Mikaʾel, fol. 36ra, l.17, and Zä-Wäldä Maryam, fol. 55vb, l.3).

extras.extra: - Notes written in pen and by a recent hand: fols. 1r-2r, 40r (upper margin), 44r (upper margin), 44va (inside the text), 47r (upper margin), 48r (upper margin), 54r (upper margin), 57v (upper margin), 59v (upper margin), 64v (bottom margin), 65rb (below the text), 65v-67v. - A black thin line is used to separate two different sections of Text I: fol. 30va, l.12.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The names of some months, encircled in thin lines, are written in the top margin indicating the monthly readings: ዘጥቅምት፡ : fol. 7v ዘ[n.l.]: fol. 12v ዘታኅሣሥ[፡]: fol. 17r ዘ[n.l.]: fol. 21r ዘመጋቢት[፡]: fol. 25v ዘሚያዝያ[፡]: fol. 29v ዘግንቦት[፡]: fol. 33v ዘሰኔ[፡]: fol. 36v ዘሐምሌ[፡]: fol. 39v
